title: The London House
author: Katherine Reay
description: Uncovering a dark family secret sends one woman through the history of Britain's WWII spy network and glamorous 1930s Paris to saev her family's reputation

title: Braiding Sweetgrass: Indigenous Wisdom, Scientific Knowledge, and the Teachings of Plants
author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
description: Drawing on her life as an indigenous scientist and as a woman, Kimmerer shows how other living beings offer us gifts and lessons, even if we've forgotten how to hear their voices

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: In a between life and death state, Nora finds herself in a large library where, as long as it stays midnight, she has the option to try out all the lives she might choose to live

title: The Lady and the Highwayman
author: Sarah M. Eden
description: A Victorian Romance that pits author against author

title: The Lion, The Witch, and the Wardrobe
author: C. S. Lewis
description: Four kids travel through a wardrobe to the land of Narnia and learn of their destiny to free it with the guidance of a mystical lion.

title: Cinder
author: Marissa Meyer
description: A futuristic sci-fi retelling of the classic Cinderlla story

title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson investigate a suspicious death in the Devonshire moors

title: Under the Tulip Tree
author: Michelle Shocklee
description: 7 years into the Great Depression, Lorena Leland accepts a position interviewing former slaves for the Federal Writers' Project
